intro: Thlaspi polymorphum, commonly known as the variable cress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. It produces small, rounded seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. Thlaspi polymorphum is also known for its ability to tolerate various environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its habitat.
